div.p: SUMMER, the name of one of the ſeaſons of the year, being one of the quarters when the year is divided into four quarters, or one half when the year is divided only into two, ſummer and winter. In the former caſe, ſummer is the quarter during which, in northern climates, the fun is passing through the three ſigns Cancer, Leo, Virgo, or from the time of the greateſt declination, till the ſun come to the equinoctial again, or have no declination ; which is from about the 21st of June till about the 22d of September. In the latter caſe, ſummer contains the six warmer months, while the ſun is on one side of the equinoctial ; and winter the other six months, when the ſun is on the other side of it. It is ſaid that a froſty winter produces a dry ſummer, and a mild winter a wet ſummer.
